meanings.definition: payment made as compensation for a murder or injury
meanings.sent1: The weregilds were paid to the family of the victim.
meanings.sent2: In ancient times, weregilds were a way to settle disputes.
meanings.sent3: The village chief collected the weregilds with a smile, knowing justice was served.
meanings.sent4: The concept of weregilds highlights the importance of accountability in society.
meanings.sent5: The weregilds were a solemn reminder of the consequences of one's actions.

meanings.definition: the value placed on a person's life in Anglo-Saxon society
meanings.sent1: Determining the weregilds was a complex process in the olden days.
meanings.sent2: The weregilds reflected the societal norms of the time.
meanings.sent3: The king's weregilds were higher than those of commoners, showing his status.
meanings.sent4: In Anglo-Saxon culture, weregilds symbolized the worth of an individual.
meanings.sent5: The concept of weregilds shed light on the intrinsic value of every person.
